text: Jan Gotlib (Bogumił) Bloch ( or Блох) (July 24, 1836 – January 7, 1902) (, , , ) was a banker from Poland. He was born in Radom and died in Warsaw. He donated money to help railways, and studied industrial warfare. Bloch published a collection of writings called La Guerre Future, translated to Is War Now Impossible?, in 1898. Category:1836 births Category:1902 deaths Category:Polish writers Category:Polish Jews
title: Jan Gotlib Bloch
